title: Raspberry Pi OS update adds Bluetooth improvements, experimental Wayland support, and more
content:
The Raspberry Pi lineup of microcomputers has officially been around for a decade now, and it’s still a popular option for everything from teaching programming to powering DIY projects. The group behind the Raspberry Pi has been working on improvements for the default operating system, and a few changes are now available to try out.

The post Raspberry Pi OS update adds Bluetooth improvements, experimental Wayland support, and more appeared first on xda-developers.
description: The default operating system for the Raspberry Pi now has experimental Wayland support, security improvements, and more.
